page.title: 15Cowdenbeath Civic Week
page.content: Cowdenbeath Civic Week gets underway when the 1985 Highland Games take place at Beath High playing fields on Sunday 30th of June.Athletes,pipers & dancers come from all over the country to this event.20 bands have entered for the pipe band contest and 100 entries have been received for the Highland dancing competition.A popular competition is the haggis hurling competition sponsored by local butcher G.Gronbach & Sons.The main athletics event is the 110 metres sprint which has a first prize of Â£200.Last year about 3000 attended the games.If the weather is good the organisers hope that there will be an even bigger crowd.
